intro: Disperis bosseri, commonly known as the Bosser's orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its small, intricate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has a compact growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves and relies on specific pollinators for reproduction. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Disperis bosseri is considered endangered and is often found in protected areas. Its botanical study contributes to the understanding of orchid diversity in tropical and subtropical ecosystems.
